Learn Circuits Today!

This is an e-Textile Circuit Drawing Application. The purpose of this project is to help you draw out circuits before you build them. Experience laying out a circuit and completely designing it, before you build it!

Learn more »

Simple Circuit

Are you new to circuits? This is great for beginners and novices! The simple circuit or series circuit requires the least amount of parts to create a functional circuit. This project includes a standard LED, alligator clips and connectors, a 3 volt coin cell battery, and a sewable battery holder. For phase 2 of a series circuit design, insert a LilyPad switch into your simple circuit design.

(If you need assistance in how a part works, visit the help section.)

Make a Simple Circuit »

e-Cuff Circuit

The e-Cuff is next on your list to tackle! In this parallel circuit design, you have different parts to play with. Experienced users may want to begin here. This project should use at least two LEDs (standard or LilyPad), alligator clips and connectors, a 3 volt coin cell battery, a choice of two types of battery holders (sewable or LilyPad), and a magnetic snap switch!

(If you need assistance in how a part works, visit the help section.)

Make an e-Cuff »

T-Shirt Circuit

This is the largest and most complicated parallel circuit design project. This project introduces the LilyPad Tiny, a board with a microcontroller, preprogrammed for different LED behaviors: blink, heartbeat, fade and random fade. You will use the LilyPad Tiny, LilyPad Battery Holder with a Switch, alligator clips and connectors, and the LilyPad LED(s) and other parts to create your design.

(If you need assistance in how a part works, visit the help section.)

Make a T-Shirt »
